work.name: Princeton PRPL Lab
work.summary: Belief-space planning with uncertainty-aware skill policies in partially observable task and motion planning. Advisor: Professor Tom Silver.
highlights: Develop conformant policies by augmenting skill policies with residual RL in POMDPs

work.name: Stanford IPRL Lab
work.summary: Dexterous manipulation with touch sensing on high-precision peg assembly and disassembly. Advisor: Professor Jeannette Bohg.
highlights: Augment VLA models with residual policy using force-torque and tactile feedback
Develop slow-fast multimodal networks for real-time control

work.name: Princeton PRPL Lab
work.summary: Automated learning of robot physical improvisations under TAMP framework. Advisors: Professor Tom Silver and Professor Benjamin Eysenbach.
highlights: Developed SLAP (Shortcut Learning for Abstract Planning), a 'plug-n-play' module to improve existing task and motion planners' plan execution efficiency
Automated the discovery of improvisational shortcuts through model-free learning by exploiting the hierarchical structure of TAMP abstractions

work.name: Google Deepmind @ Princeton
work.summary: Computational optimizations for hybrid STU-Attention models. Advisor: Professor Elad Hazan.
highlights: Proposed Flash STU architecture achieving state-of-the-art performance in language modeling
Optimized tensordot-based convolution with k fixed spectral filters, reducing computational complexity by a factor of k.

volunteer.summary: Lead student organization for AI research and education at Princeton.
highlights: Organize annual AI Tiger Trek to San Francisco connecting students with AI researchers and startups
Lead weekly research talks and professor Q&As

volunteer.summary: Teaching assistant for Computer Science courses.
highlights: Hold office hours for COS 226 'Algorithms and Data Structures' and COS 217 'Introduction to Programming Systems'
